vue-components.name: el-affix
vue-components.description: Fix the element to a specific visible area.

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when fixed state changed

events.name: scroll
events.description: triggers when scrolling

vue-components.name: el-alert
vue-components.description: Displays important alert messages.

props.name: center
props.description: whether content is placed in the center.

props.name: show-icon
props.description: whether a type icon is displayed.

events.name: close
events.description: trigger when alert is closed.

vue-components.name: el-anchor
vue-components.description: Through the anchor point, you can quickly find the position of the information content on the current page.

slots.name: default
slots.description: the content of the anchor link.

events.name: change
events.description: callback when the step changes

events.name: click
events.description: Triggered when the user clicks on the link

vue-components.name: el-autocomplete
vue-components.description: Get some recommended tips based on the current input.

props.name: value-key
props.description: key name of the input suggestion object for display

props.name: debounce
props.description: debounce delay when typing, in milliseconds

props.name: fetch-suggestions
props.description: a method to fetch input suggestions. When suggestions are ready, invoke `callback(data:[])` to return them to Autocomplete

props.name: trigger-on-focus
props.description: whether show suggestions when input focus

props.name: select-when-unmatched
props.description: whether to emit a `select` event on enter when there is no autocomplete match

props.name: hide-loading
props.description: whether to hide the loading icon in remote search

props.name: popper-class
props.description: custom class name for autocomplete's dropdown

props.name: teleported
props.description: whether select dropdown is teleported to the body

props.name: highlight-first-item
props.description: whether to highlight first item in remote search suggestions by default

props.name: fit-input-width
props.description: whether the width of the dropdown is the same as the input

props.name: popper-append-to-body
props.description: whether to append the dropdown to body. If the positioning of the dropdown is wrong, you can try to set this prop to false

events.name: blur
events.description: triggers when Input blurs

events.name: focus
events.description: triggers when Input focuses

events.name: input
events.description: triggers when the Input value change

events.name: clear
events.description: triggers when the Input is cleared by clicking the clear button

events.name: select
events.description: triggers when a suggestion is clicked

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the icon inside Input value change

vue-components.name: el-avatar
vue-components.description: Avatars can be used to represent people or objects. It supports images, Icons, or characters.

props.name: icon
props.description: representation type to icon, more info on icon component.

props.name: src
props.description: the source of the image for an image avatar.

props.name: fit
props.description: set how the image fit its container for an image avatar.

events.name: error
events.description: trigger when image load error.

vue-components.name: el-backtop
vue-components.description: A button to back to top.

props.name: visibility-height
props.description: the button will not show until the scroll height reaches this value.

events.name: click
events.description: triggers when click.

vue-components.name: el-badge
vue-components.description: A number or status mark on buttons and icons.

props.name: max
props.description: maximum value, shows `{max}+` when exceeded. Only works if value is a number.

props.name: is-dot
props.description: if a little dot is displayed.

props.name: show-zero
props.description: Whether to show badge when value is zero.

vue-components.name: el-breadcrumb
vue-components.description: Displays the location of the current page, making it easier to browser back.

props.name: to
props.description: target route of the link, same as `to` of `vue-router`

props.name: replace
props.description: if `true`, the navigation will not leave a history record

vue-components.name: el-button
vue-components.description: Commonly used button.

props.name: size
props.description: control the size of buttons in this button-group

props.name: type
props.description: control the type of buttons in this button-group

vue-components.name: el-calendar
vue-components.description: Display date.

props.name: range
props.description: time range, including start time and end time. Start time must be start day of week, end time must be end day of week, the time span cannot exceed two months.

slots.name: date-cell
slots.description: `type` indicates which month the date belongs, optional values are prev-month, current-month, next-month; `isSelected` indicates whether the date is selected; `day` is the formatted date in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`; `date` is date the cell represents
slots.type: { data: { type: 'prev-month' | 'current-month' | 'next-month', isSelected: boolean, day: string, date: Date } }

vue-components.name: el-card
vue-components.description: Integrate information in a card container.

props.name: header
props.description: title of the card. Also accepts a DOM passed by `slot#header`

props.name: footer
props.description: footer of the card. Also accepts a DOM passed by `slot#footer`

props.name: body-class
props.description: custom class name of card body

vue-components.name: el-carousel
vue-components.description: Loop a series of images or texts in a limited space

props.name: name
props.description: name of the item, can be used in `setActiveItem`

props.name: label
props.description: text content for the corresponding indicator

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the active slide switches, it has two parameters, the one is the index of the new active slide, and other is index of the old active slide

vue-components.name: el-cascader
vue-components.description: If the options have a clear hierarchical structure, Cascader can be used to view and select them.

props.name: options
props.description: data of the options, the key of `value` and `label` can be customize by `CascaderProps`.

props.name: props
props.description: configuration options, see the following `CascaderProps` table.

slots.name: default
slots.description: the custom content of cascader node, which are current Node object and node data respectively.

slots.name: empty
slots.description: the content of the panel when there is no data.

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the binding value changes

events.name: expand-change
events.description: triggers when expand option changes

events.name: close
events.description: close panel event, provided to Cascader to put away the panel judgment.

vue-components.name: el-checkbox
vue-components.description: A group of options for multiple choices.

props.name: value
props.description: value of the checkbox when used inside a `checkbox-group`

props.name: label
props.description: label of the checkbox when used inside a `checkbox-group`. If there's no value, `label` will act as `value`

props.name: true-value
props.description: value of the checkbox if it's checked

props.name: false-value
props.description: value of the checkbox if it's not checked

props.name: true-label
props.description: value of the checkbox if it's checked

props.name: false-label
props.description: value of the checkbox if it's not checked

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the binding value changes

vue-components.name: el-collapse
vue-components.description: Use Collapse to store contents.

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when active panels change, the parameter type is `string` in accordion mode, otherwise it is `array`

vue-components.name: el-color-picker
vue-components.description: ColorPicker is a color selector supporting multiple color formats.

props.name: show-alpha
props.description: whether to display the alpha slider

props.name: popper-class
props.description: custom class name for ColorPicker's dropdown

props.name: teleported
props.description: whether color-picker popper is teleported to the body

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when input value changes

events.name: active-change
events.description: triggers when the current active color changes

events.name: focus
events.description: triggers when Component focuses

events.name: blur
events.description: triggers when Component blurs

vue-components.name: el-config-provider
vue-components.description: Config Provider is used for providing global configurations, which enables your entire application to access these configurations everywhere.

props.name: button
props.description: button related configuration, [see the following table](#button-attribute)

props.name: message
props.description: message related configuration, [see the following table](#message-attribute)

props.name: experimental-features
props.description: features at experimental stage to be added, all features are default to be set to false

vue-components.name: el-container
vue-components.description: Container components for scaffolding basic structure of the page:

vue-components.name: el-date-picker
vue-components.description: Use Date Picker for date input.

props.name: model-value
props.description: binding value, if it is an array, the length should be 2

props.name: start-placeholder
props.description: placeholder for the start date in range mode

props.name: end-placeholder
props.description: placeholder for the end date in range mode

props.name: format
props.description: format of the displayed value in the input box

props.name: popper-class
props.description: custom class name for DatePicker's dropdown

props.name: popper-options
props.description: Customized popper option see more at [popper.js](https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/)

props.name: default-value
props.description: optional, default date of the calendar

props.name: default-time
props.description: optional, the time value to use when selecting date range

props.name: value-format
props.description: optional, format of binding value. If not specified, the binding value will be a Date object

props.name: prefix-icon
props.description: custom prefix icon component. By default, if the value of `type` is `TimeLikeType`, the value is `Clock`, else is `Calendar`

props.name: disabled-date
props.description: a function determining if a date is disabled with that date as its parameter. Should return a Boolean

props.name: shortcuts
props.description: an object array to set shortcut options
type: Array<{ text: string, value: Date | Function }>

props.name: teleported
props.description: whether date-picker dropdown is teleported to the body

props.name: fallback-placements
props.description: list of possible positions for Tooltip [popper.js](https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/modifiers/flip/#fallbackplacements)

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when user confirms the value

events.name: blur
events.description: triggers when Input blurs

events.name: focus
events.description: triggers when Input focuses

events.name: clear
events.description: triggers when the clear icon is clicked in a clearable DatePicker

events.name: calendar-change
events.description: triggers when the calendar selected date is changed.

events.name: panel-change
events.description: triggers when the navigation button click.

events.name: visible-change
events.description: triggers when the DatePicker's dropdown appears/disappears

vue-components.name: el-descriptions
vue-components.description: Display multiple fields in list form.

props.name: rowspan
props.description: the number of rows a cell should span

props.name: width
props.description: column width, the width of the same column in different rows is set by the max value (If no `border`, width contains label and content)

props.name: min-width
props.description: column minimum width, columns with `width` has a fixed width, while columns with `min-width` has a width that is distributed in proportion (If no`border`, width contains label and content)

props.name: label-width
props.description: column label width, if not set, it will be the same as the width of the column. Higher priority than the `label-width` of `Descriptions`

props.name: align
props.description: column content alignment (If no `border`, effective for both label and content)

props.name: label-align
props.description: column label alignment, if omitted, the value of the above `align` attribute will be applied (If no `border`, please use `align` attribute)

vue-components.name: el-dialog
vue-components.description: Informs users while preserving the current page state.

props.name: title
props.description: title of Dialog. Can also be passed with a named slot (see the following table)

props.name: fullscreen
props.description: whether the Dialog takes up full screen

props.name: top
props.description: value for `margin-top` of Dialog CSS, default is 15vh

props.name: header-class
props.description: custom class names for header wrapper

props.name: body-class
props.description: custom class names for body wrapper

props.name: footer-class
props.description: custom class names for footer wrapper

props.name: append-to-body
props.description: whether to append Dialog itself to body. A nested Dialog should have this attribute set to `true`

props.name: append-to
props.description: which element the Dialog appends to. Will override `append-to-body`

props.name: lock-scroll
props.description: whether scroll of body is disabled while Dialog is displayed

props.name: close-on-click-modal
props.description: whether the Dialog can be closed by clicking the mask

props.name: close-on-press-escape
props.description: whether the Dialog can be closed by pressing ESC

props.name: show-close
props.description: whether to show a close button

props.name: before-close
props.description: callback before Dialog closes, and it will prevent Dialog from closing, use done to close the dialog

props.name: overflow
props.description: draggable Dialog can overflow the viewport

props.name: center
props.description: whether to align the header and footer in center

props.name: align-center
props.description: whether to align the dialog both horizontally and vertically

props.name: destroy-on-close
props.description: destroy elements in Dialog when closed

props.name: close-icon
props.description: custom close icon, default is Close

props.name: z-index
props.description: same as z-index in native CSS, z-order of dialog

slots.name: header
slots.description: content of the Dialog header; Replacing this removes the title, but does not remove the close button.

slots.name: title
slots.description: works the same as the header slot. Use that instead.

events.name: open
events.description: triggers when the Dialog opens

events.name: opened
events.description: triggers when the Dialog opening animation ends

events.name: close
events.description: triggers when the Dialog closes

events.name: closed
events.description: triggers when the Dialog closing animation ends

events.name: open-auto-focus
events.description: triggers after Dialog opens and content focused

events.name: close-auto-focus
events.description: triggers after Dialog closed and content focused

vue-components.name: el-divider
vue-components.description: The dividing line that separates the content.

props.name: content-position
props.description: the position of the customized content on the divider line

slots.name: default
slots.description: customized content on the divider line

vue-components.name: el-drawer
vue-components.description: Sometimes, `Dialog` does not always satisfy our requirements, let's say you have a massive form, or you need space to display something like `terms & conditions`, `Drawer` has almost identical API with `Dialog`, but it introduces different user experience.

props.name: append-to-body
props.description: Controls should Drawer be inserted to DocumentBody Element, nested Drawer must assign this param to **true**

props.name: append-to
props.description: which element the Drawer appends to. Will override `append-to-body`

props.name: lock-scroll
props.description: whether scroll of body is disabled while Drawer is displayed

props.name: before-close
props.description: If set, closing procedure will be halted

props.name: close-on-click-modal
props.description: whether the Drawer can be closed by clicking the mask

props.name: close-on-press-escape
props.description: Indicates whether Drawer can be closed by pressing ESC

props.name: destroy-on-close
props.description: Indicates whether children should be destroyed after Drawer closed

props.name: show-close
props.description: Should show close button at the top right of Drawer

props.name: size
props.description: Drawer's size, if Drawer is horizontal mode, it effects the width property, otherwise it effects the height property, when size is `number` type, it describes the size by unit of pixels; when size is `string` type, it should be used with `x%` notation, other wise it will be interpreted to pixel unit

props.name: title
props.description: Drawer's title, can also be set by named slot, detailed descriptions can be found in the slot form

props.name: with-header
props.description: Flag that controls the header section's existance, default to true, when withHeader set to false, both `title attribute` and `title slot` won't work

props.name: modal-class
props.description: Extra class names for shadowing layer

props.name: header-class
props.description: custom class names for header wrapper

props.name: body-class
props.description: custom class names for body wrapper

props.name: footer-class
props.description: custom class names for footer wrapper

slots.name: header
slots.description: Drawer header section; Replacing this removes the title, but does not remove the close button.

slots.name: title
slots.description: Works the same as the header slot. Use that instead.

events.name: open
events.description: Triggered before Drawer opening animation begins

events.name: opened
events.description: Triggered after Drawer opening animation ended

events.name: close
events.description: Triggered before Drawer closing animation begins

events.name: closed
events.description: Triggered after Drawer closing animation ended

events.name: open-auto-focus
events.description: triggers after Drawer opens and content focused

events.name: close-auto-focus
events.description: triggers after Drawer closed and content focused

vue-components.name: el-dropdown
vue-components.description: Toggleable menu for displaying lists of links and actions.

props.name: command
props.description: a command to be dispatched to Dropdown's `command` callback

events.name: click
events.description: if `split-button` is `true`, triggers when left button is clicked

events.name: command
events.description: triggers when a dropdown item is clicked, the parameters is the command dispatched from the dropdown item

events.name: visible-change
events.description: triggers when the dropdown appears/disappears, the param is true when it appears, and false otherwise

vue-components.name: el-empty
vue-components.description: Placeholder hints for empty states.

vue-components.name: el-form
vue-components.description: Form consists of `input`, `radio`, `select`, `checkbox` and so on. With form, you can collect, verify and submit data.

props.name: prop
props.description: A key of `model`. It could be a path of the property (e.g `a.b.0` or `['a', 'b', '0']`). In the use of `validate` and `resetFields` method, the attribute is required.

props.name: label-position
props.description: Position of item label. If set to `'left'` or `'right'`, `label-width` prop is also required. Default extend `label-postion` of `form`.

props.name: label-width
props.description: Width of label, e.g. `'50px'`. `'auto'` is supported.

props.name: required
props.description: Whether the field is required or not, will be determined by validation rules if omitted.

props.name: rules
props.description: Validation rules of form, see the [following table](#formitemrule), more advanced usage at [async-validator](https://github.com/yiminghe/async-validator).

props.name: error
props.description: Field error message, set its value and the field will validate error and show this message immediately.

props.name: show-message
props.description: Whether to show the error message.

props.name: size
props.description: Control the size of components in this form-item.

props.name: for
props.description: Same as for in native label.

slots.name: label
slots.description: Custom content to display on label.

slots.name: error
slots.description: Custom content to display validation message.

events.name: validate
events.description: triggers after a form item is validated

vue-components.name: el-icon
vue-components.description: Element Plus provides a set of common icons.

props.name: size
props.description: SVG icon size, size x size

vue-components.name: el-image
vue-components.description: Besides the native features of img, support lazy load, custom placeholder and load failure, etc.

props.name: initial-index
props.description: the initial preview image index, less than or equal to the length of `url-list`.

props.name: hide-on-click-modal
props.description: whether user can emit close event when clicking backdrop.

props.name: teleported
props.description: whether to append image itself to body. A nested parent element attribute transform should have this attribute set to `true`.

props.name: zoom-rate
props.description: the zoom rate of the image viewer zoom event.

props.name: min-scale
props.description: the min scale of the image viewer zoom event.

props.name: max-scale
props.description: the max scale of the image viewer zoom event.

props.name: close-on-press-escape
props.description: whether the image-viewer can be closed by pressing ESC.

props.name: show-progress
props.description: whether to display the preview image progress content

slots.name: placeholder
slots.description: custom placeholder content when image hasn't loaded yet.

slots.name: progress
slots.description: custom progress content when image preview.

slots.name: toolbar
slots.description: custom toolbar content when image preview.
slots.type: {actions: (action: ImageViewerAction, options?: ImageViewerActionOptions ) => void, prev: ()=> void, next: () => void,reset: () => void, activeIndex: number }

events.name: close
events.description: trigger when clicking on close button or when `hide-on-click-modal` enabled clicking on backdrop.

events.name: switch
events.description: trigger when switching images.

events.name: rotate
events.description: trigger when rotating images.

vue-components.name: el-input-number
vue-components.description: Input numerical values with a customizable range.

props.name: step-strictly
props.description: whether input value can only be multiple of step

props.name: controls
props.description: whether to enable the control buttons

props.name: value-on-clear
props.description: value should be set when input box is cleared

slots.name: decrease-icon
slots.description: custom input box button decrease icon

slots.name: increase-icon
slots.description: custom input box button increase icon

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the value changes

events.name: blur
events.description: triggers when Input blurs

events.name: focus
events.description: triggers when Input focuses

vue-components.name: el-input-tag
vue-components.description: The InputTag component allows users to add content as tags.

props.name: max
props.description: max number tags that can be enter

props.name: trigger
props.description: the key to trigger input tag

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the modelValue change

events.name: input
events.description: triggers when the input value change

events.name: add-tag
events.description: triggers when a tag is added

events.name: remove-tag
events.description: triggers when a tag is removed

events.name: focus
events.description: triggers when InputTag focuses

events.name: blur
events.description: triggers when InputTag blurs

events.name: clear
events.description: triggers when the clear icon is clicked

vue-components.name: el-input
vue-components.description: Input data using mouse or keyboard.

props.name: show-word-limit
props.description: whether show word count, only works when `type` is 'text' or 'textarea'

props.name: clearable
props.description: whether to show clear button, only works when `type` is not 'textarea'

props.name: formatter
props.description: specifies the format of the value presented input.(only works when `type` is 'text')

props.name: parser
props.description: specifies the value extracted from formatter input.(only works when `type` is 'text')

props.name: show-password
props.description: whether to show toggleable password input

props.name: size
props.description: size of Input, works when `type` is not 'textarea'

props.name: rows
props.description: number of rows of textarea, only works when `type` is 'textarea'

props.name: autosize
props.description: whether textarea has an adaptive height, only works when `type` is 'textarea'. Can accept an object, e.g. `{ minRows: 2, maxRows: 6 }`

props.name: input-style
props.description: the style of the input element or textarea element

slots.name: prefix
slots.description: content as Input prefix, only works when `type` is not 'textarea'

slots.name: suffix
slots.description: content as Input suffix, only works when `type` is not 'textarea'

slots.name: prepend
slots.description: content to prepend before Input, only works when `type` is not 'textarea'

slots.name: append
slots.description: content to append after Input, only works when `type` is not 'textarea'

events.name: blur
events.description: triggers when Input blurs

events.name: focus
events.description: triggers when Input focuses

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the input box loses focus or the user presses Enter, only if the modelValue has changed

events.name: input
events.description: triggers when the Input value change

events.name: clear
events.description: triggers when the Input is cleared by clicking the clear button

vue-components.name: el-layout
vue-components.description: Quickly and easily create layouts with the basic 24-column.

props.name: span
props.description: number of column the grid spans

props.name: offset
props.description: number of spacing on the left side of the grid

props.name: push
props.description: number of columns that grid moves to the right

props.name: pull
props.description: number of columns that grid moves to the left

props.name: xs
props.description: `<768px` Responsive columns or column props object
type: {span?: number, offset?: number, pull?: number, push?: number}

props.name: sm
props.description: `≥768px` Responsive columns or column props object
type: {span?: number, offset?: number, pull?: number, push?: number}

props.name: md
props.description: `≥992px` Responsive columns or column props object
type: {span?: number, offset?: number, pull?: number, push?: number}

props.name: lg
props.description: `≥1200px` Responsive columns or column props object
type: {span?: number, offset?: number, pull?: number, push?: number}

props.name: xl
props.description: `≥1920px` Responsive columns or column props object
type: {span?: number, offset?: number, pull?: number, push?: number}

vue-components.name: el-link
vue-components.description: Text hyperlink

vue-components.name: el-mention
vue-components.description: Used to mention someone or something in an input.

props.name: prefix
props.description: prefix character to trigger mentions. The string length must be exactly 1

props.name: split
props.description: character to split mentions. The string length must be exactly 1

props.name: show-arrow
props.description: whether the dropdown panel has an arrow

props.name: whole
props.description: when backspace is pressed to delete, whether the mention content is deleted as a whole

props.name: check-is-whole
props.description: when backspace is pressed to delete, check if the mention is a whole

props.name: loading
props.description: whether the dropdown panel of mentions is in a loading state

props.name: popper-class
props.description: custom class name for dropdown panel

slots.name: header
slots.description: content at the top of the dropdown

slots.name: footer
slots.description: content at the bottom of the dropdown

events.name: search
events.description: trigger when prefix hit

events.name: select
events.description: trigger when user select the option

vue-components.name: el-menu
vue-components.description: Menu that provides navigation for your website.

events.name: click
events.description: callback function when menu-item is clicked, the param is menu-item instance

vue-components.name: el-page-header
vue-components.description: If path of the page is simple, it is recommended to use PageHeader instead of the Breadcrumb.

props.name: title
props.description: main title of page header, default is Back that built-in a11y

events.name: back
events.description: triggers when right side is clicked

vue-components.name: el-pagination
vue-components.description: If you have too much data to display in one page, use pagination.

props.name: background
props.description: whether the buttons have a background color

props.name: default-page-size
props.description: default initial value of page size, not setting is the same as setting 10

props.name: page-count
props.description: total page count. Set either `total` or `page-count` and pages will be displayed; if you need `page-sizes`, `total` is required

props.name: pager-count
props.description: number of pagers. Pagination collapses when the total page count exceeds this value

props.name: default-current-page
props.description: default initial value of current-page, not setting is the same as setting 1

props.name: layout
props.description: layout of Pagination, elements separated with a comma

props.name: page-sizes
props.description: options of item count per page

props.name: append-size-to
props.description: which element the size dropdown appends to

props.name: popper-class
props.description: custom class name for the page size Select's dropdown

props.name: prev-icon
props.description: icon for the prev button, has a lower priority than `prev-text`

props.name: next-icon
props.description: icon for the next button, has a lower priority than `next-text`

props.name: teleported
props.description: whether Pagination select dropdown is teleported to the body

props.name: hide-on-single-page
props.description: whether to hide when there's only one page

slots.name: default
slots.description: custom content. To use this, you need to declare `slot` in `layout`

events.name: size-change
events.description: triggers when `page-size` changes

events.name: current-change
events.description: triggers when `current-page` changes

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when `current-page` or `page-size` changes

events.name: prev-click
events.description: triggers when the prev button is clicked and current page changes

events.name: next-click
events.description: triggers when the next button is clicked and current page changes

vue-components.name: el-popconfirm
vue-components.description: A simple confirmation dialog of an element click action.

props.name: teleported
props.description: whether popconfirm is teleported to the body

props.name: persistent
props.description: when popconfirm inactive and `persistent` is `false` , popconfirm will be destroyed

slots.name: actions
slots.type: { confirm: (e: MouseEvent) => void, cancel: (e: MouseEvent) => void }

events.name: confirm
events.description: triggers when click confirm button

events.name: cancel
events.description: triggers when click cancel button

props.name: content
props.description: popover content, can be replaced with a default `slot`

props.name: offset
props.description: popover offset, `Popover` is built with `Tooltip`, offset of `Popover` is `undefined`, but offset of `Tooltip` is 12

props.name: transition
props.description: popover transition animation, the default is el-fade-in-linear

props.name: show-arrow
props.description: whether a tooltip arrow is displayed or not. For more info, please refer to [ElPopper](https://github.com/element-plus/element-plus/tree/dev/packages/components/popper)

props.name: auto-close
props.description: timeout in milliseconds to hide tooltip

props.name: teleported
props.description: whether popover dropdown is teleported to the body

props.name: persistent
props.description: when popover inactive and `persistent` is `false` , popover will be destroyed

events.name: show
events.description: triggers when popover shows

events.name: before-enter
events.description: triggers when the entering transition before

events.name: after-enter
events.description: triggers when the entering transition ends

events.name: hide
events.description: triggers when popover hides

events.name: before-leave
events.description: triggers when the leaving transition before

events.name: after-leave
events.description: triggers when the leaving transition ends

vue-components.name: el-progress
vue-components.description: Progress is used to show the progress of current operation, and inform the user the current status.

props.name: text-inside
props.description: whether to place the percentage inside progress bar, only works when `type` is 'line'

props.name: status
props.description: the current status of progress bar

props.name: duration
props.description: control the animation duration of indeterminate progress or striped flow progress

props.name: color
props.description: background color of progress bar. Overrides `status` prop

props.name: width
props.description: the canvas width of circle progress bar

props.name: stroke-linecap
props.description: circle/dashboard type shape at the end path

props.name: striped
props.description: stripe over the progress bar's color

vue-components.name: el-radio
vue-components.description: Single selection among multiple options.

props.name: label
props.description: the label of Radio. If there's no `value`, `label` will act as `value`

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the bound value changes

vue-components.name: el-rate
vue-components.description: Used for rating

props.name: allow-half
props.description: whether picking half start is allowed

props.name: low-threshold
props.description: threshold value between low and medium level. The value itself will be included in low level

props.name: high-threshold
props.description: threshold value between medium and high level. The value itself will be included in high level

props.name: colors
props.description: colors for icons. If array, it should have 3 elements, each of which corresponds with a score level, else if object, the key should be threshold value between two levels, and the value should be corresponding color

props.name: icons
props.description: icon components. If array, it should have 3 elements, each of which corresponds with a score level, else if object, the key should be threshold value between two levels, and the value should be corresponding icon component

props.name: show-score
props.description: whether to display current score. show-score and show-text cannot be true at the same time

props.name: clearable
props.description: whether value can be reset to `0`

events.name: change
events.description: Triggers when rate value is changed

vue-components.name: el-result
vue-components.description: Used to give feedback on the result of user's operation or access exception.

vue-components.name: el-scrollbar
vue-components.description: Used to replace the browser's native scrollbar.

props.name: native
props.description: whether to use the native scrollbar style

props.name: noresize
props.description: do not respond to container size changes, if the container size does not change, it is better to set it to optimize performance

events.name: scroll
events.description: triggers when scrolling, return distance of scrolling

vue-components.name: el-segmented
vue-components.description: Display multiple options and allow users to select a single option.

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the selected value changes, the param is current selected value

vue-components.name: el-virtualized-select
vue-components.description: :::tip

props.name: options
props.description: data of the options, the key of `value` and `label` can be customize by `props`

props.name: props
props.description: configuration options, see the following table

props.name: value-key
props.description: unique identity key name for value, required when value is an object

props.name: collapse-tags
props.description: whether to collapse tags to a text when multiple selecting

props.name: multiple-limit
props.description: maximum number of options user can select when multiple is true. No limit when set to 0

props.name: name
props.description: the name attribute of select input

props.name: allow-create
props.description: whether creating new items is allowed. To use this, `filterable` must be true

props.name: loading
props.description: whether Select is loading data from server

props.name: loading-text
props.description: displayed text while loading data from server, default is 'Loading'

props.name: reserve-keyword
props.description: whether reserve the keyword after select filtered option.

props.name: no-match-text
props.description: displayed text when no data matches the filtering query, you can also use slot `empty`, default is 'No matching data'

props.name: no-data-text
props.description: displayed text when there is no options, you can also use slot empty

props.name: popper-class
props.description: custom class name for Select's dropdown

props.name: teleported
props.description: whether select dropdown is teleported, if `true` it will be teleported to where `append-to` sets

props.name: append-to
props.description: which element the select dropdown appends to

props.name: persistent
props.description: when select dropdown is inactive and `persistent` is `false`, select dropdown will be destroyed

props.name: automatic-dropdown
props.description: for non-filterable Select, this prop decides if the option menu pops up when the input is focused

props.name: fit-input-width
props.description: whether the width of the dropdown is the same as the input, if the value is `number`, then the width is fixed

props.name: height
props.description: The height of the dropdown panel, 34px for each item

props.name: item-height
props.description: The height of the dropdown item

props.name: scrollbar-always-on
props.description: Controls whether the scrollbar is always displayed

props.name: remote-method
props.description: function that gets called when the input value changes. Its parameter is the current input value. To use this, `filterable` must be true

props.name: show-arrow
props.description: whether the dropdown has an arrow

props.name: fallback-placements
props.description: list of possible positions for dropdown [popper.js](https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/modifiers/flip/#fallbackplacements)

props.name: collapse-tags-tooltip
props.description: whether show all selected tags when mouse hover text of collapse-tags. To use this, `collapse-tags` must be true

props.name: max-collapse-tags
props.description: The max tags number to be shown. To use this, `collapse-tags` must be true

props.name: popper-append-to-body
props.description: whether to append the popper menu to body. If the positioning of the popper is wrong, you can try to set this prop to false

slots.name: header
slots.description: content at the top of the dropdown

slots.name: footer
slots.description: content at the bottom of the dropdown

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the selected value changes, the param is current selected value

events.name: visible-change
events.description: triggers when the dropdown appears/disappears, the param will be true when it appears, and false otherwise

events.name: remove-tag
events.description: triggers when a tag is removed in multiple mode, the param is removed tag value

events.name: clear
events.description: triggers when the clear icon is clicked in a clearable Select

events.name: blur
events.description: triggers when Input blurs

events.name: focus
events.description: triggers when Input focuses

vue-components.name: el-select
vue-components.description: When there are plenty of options, use a drop-down menu to display and select desired ones.

props.name: label
props.description: label of option, same as `value` if omitted

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the selected value changes

events.name: visible-change
events.description: triggers when the dropdown appears/disappears

events.name: remove-tag
events.description: triggers when a tag is removed in multiple mode

events.name: clear
events.description: triggers when the clear icon is clicked in a clearable Select

events.name: blur
events.description: triggers when Input blurs

events.name: focus
events.description: triggers when Input focuses

events.name: popup-scroll
events.description: triggers when dropdown scrolls

vue-components.name: el-skeleton
vue-components.description: When loading data, and you need a rich experience for visual and interactions for your end users, you can choose `skeleton`.

vue-components.name: el-slider
vue-components.description: Drag the slider within a fixed range.

props.name: show-input
props.description: whether to display an input box, works when `range` is false

props.name: show-input-controls
props.description: whether to display control buttons when `show-input` is true

props.name: size
props.description: size of the slider wrapper, will not work in vertical mode

props.name: input-size
props.description: size of the input box, when set `size`, the default is the value of `size`

props.name: height
props.description: slider height, required in vertical mode

props.name: range-start-label
props.description: when `range` is true, screen reader label for the start of the range

props.name: range-end-label
props.description: when `range` is true, screen reader label for the end of the range

props.name: format-value-text
props.description: format to display the `aria-valuenow` attribute for screen readers

props.name: debounce
props.description: debounce delay when typing, in milliseconds, works when `show-input` is true

props.name: tooltip-class
props.description: custom class name for the tooltip

props.name: marks
props.description: marks, type of key must be `number` and must in closed interval `[min, max]`, each mark can custom style

props.name: persistent
props.description: when slider tooltip inactive and `persistent` is `false` , popconfirm will be destroyed. `persistent` always be `false` when `show-tooltip ` is `false`

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when the value changes (if the mouse is being dragged, this event only fires when the mouse is released)

events.name: input
events.description: triggers when the data changes (It'll be emitted in real time during sliding)

vue-components.name: el-space
vue-components.description: Even though we have [Divider]

vue-components.name: el-statistic
vue-components.description: Display statistics.

vue-components.name: el-steps
vue-components.description: Guide the user to complete tasks in accordance with the process. Its steps can be set according to the actual application scenario and the number of the steps can't be less than 2.

props.name: icon
props.description: step custom icon. Icons can be passed via named slot as well

props.name: status
props.description: current status. It will be automatically set by Steps if not configured.

vue-components.name: el-switch
vue-components.description: Switch is used for switching between two opposing states.

props.name: model-value
props.description: binding value, it should be equivalent to either `active-value` or `inactive-value`, by default it's `boolean` type

props.name: loading
props.description: whether Switch is in loading state

props.name: inline-prompt
props.description: whether icon or text is displayed inside dot, only the first character will be rendered for text

props.name: active-icon
props.description: component of the icon displayed when in `on` state, overrides `active-text`

props.name: inactive-icon
props.description: component of the icon displayed when in `off` state, overrides `inactive-text`

props.name: active-action-icon
props.description: component of the icon displayed in action when in `on` state

props.name: inactive-action-icon
props.description: component of the icon displayed in action when in `off` state

props.name: before-change
props.description: before-change hook before the switch state changes. If `false` is returned or a `Promise` is returned and then is rejected, will stop switching

props.name: active-color
props.description: background color when in `on` state ( use CSS var `--el-switch-on-color` instead )

props.name: inactive-color
props.description: background color when in `off` state ( use CSS var `--el-switch-off-color` instead )

props.name: border-color
props.description: border color of the switch ( use CSS var `--el-switch-border-color` instead )

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when value changes

vue-components.name: el-virtualized-table
vue-components.description: Along with evolutionary web development, table component has always been the most popular component in our web apps especially for dashboards, data analysis. For [Table V1]

props.name: cache
props.description: Number of rows rendered in advance to boost the performance

props.name: estimated-row-height
props.description: The estimated row height for rendering dynamic height rows

props.name: header-class
props.description: Customized class name passed to header wrapper

props.name: header-props
props.description: Customized props name passed to header component

props.name: header-cell-props
props.description: Customized props name passed to header cell component

props.name: header-height
props.description: The height of the header is set by `height`. If given an array, it renders header rows equal to its length

props.name: footer-height
props.description: The height of the footer element, when provided, will be part to the calculation of the table's height.

props.name: row-class
props.description: Customized class name passed to row wrapper

props.name: row-key
props.description: The key of each row, if not provided, will be the index of the row

props.name: row-props
props.description: Customized props name passed to row component

props.name: row-height
props.description: The height of each row, used for calculating the total height of the table

props.name: cell-props
props.description: extra props passed to each cell (except header cells)

props.name: data
props.description: An array of data to be rendered in the table.

props.name: data-getter
props.description: A method to customize data fetch from the data source.

props.name: fixed-data
props.description: Data for rendering rows above the main content and below the header

props.name: expand-column-key
props.description: The column key indicates which row is expandable

props.name: expanded-row-keys
props.description: An array of keys for expanded rows, can be used with `v-model`

props.name: default-expanded-row-keys
props.description: An array of keys for default expanded rows, **NON REACTIVE**

props.name: class
props.description: Class name for the virtual table, will be applied to all three tables (left, right, main)

props.name: fixed
props.description: Flag indicates the table column's width to be fixed or flexible.

props.name: h-scrollbar-size
props.description: Indicates the horizontal scrollbar's size for the table, used to prevent the horizontal and vertical scrollbar to collapse

props.name: v-scrollbar-size
props.description: Indicates the vertical scrollbar's size for the table, used to prevent the horizontal and vertical scrollbar to collapse

props.name: scrollbar-always-on
props.description: If true, the scrollbar will always be shown instead of when mouse is placed above the table

events.name: column-sort
events.description: Invoked when column sorted

events.name: expanded-rows-change
events.description: Invoked when expanded rows changed

events.name: end-reached
events.description: Invoked when the end of the table is reached

events.name: scroll
events.description: Invoked after scrolling

events.name: rows-rendered
events.description: Invoked when rows are rendered

events.name: row-expand
events.description: Invoked when expand/collapse the tree node by clicking the arrow icon

events.name: row-event-handlers
events.description: A collection of handlers attached to each row

vue-components.name: el-table
vue-components.description: Display multiple data with similar format. You can sort, filter, compare your data in a table.

props.name: height
props.description: table's height. By default it has an `auto` height. If its value is a number, the height is measured in pixels; if its value is a string, the value will be assigned to element's style.height, the height is affected by external styles

props.name: max-height
props.description: table's max-height. The legal value is a number or the height in px

props.name: fit
props.description: whether width of column automatically fits its container

props.name: current-row-key
props.description: key of current row, a set only prop

props.name: row-class-name
props.description: function that returns custom class names for a row, or a string assigning class names for every row

props.name: row-style
props.description: function that returns custom style for a row, or an object assigning custom style for every row

props.name: cell-class-name
props.description: function that returns custom class names for a cell, or a string assigning class names for every cell
type: (data: { row: any, column: any, rowIndex: number, columnIndex: number }) => string

props.name: cell-style
props.description: function that returns custom style for a cell, or an object assigning custom style for every cell
type: (data: { row: any, column: any, rowIndex: number, columnIndex: number }) => CSSProperties

props.name: header-row-class-name
props.description: function that returns custom class names for a row in table header, or a string assigning class names for every row in table header

props.name: header-row-style
props.description: function that returns custom style for a row in table header, or an object assigning custom style for every row in table header

props.name: header-cell-class-name
props.description: function that returns custom class names for a cell in table header, or a string assigning class names for every cell in table header
type: (data: { row: any, column: any, rowIndex: number, columnIndex: number }) => string

props.name: header-cell-style
props.description: function that returns custom style for a cell in table header, or an object assigning custom style for every cell in table header
type: (data: { row: any, column: any, rowIndex: number, columnIndex: number }) => CSSProperties

props.name: row-key
props.description: key of row data, used for optimizing rendering. Required if `reserve-selection` is on or display tree data. When its type is String, multi-level access is supported, e.g. `user.info.id`, but `user.info[0].id` is not supported, in which case `Function` should be used

props.name: empty-text
props.description: displayed text when data is empty. You can customize this area with `#empty`

props.name: default-expand-all
props.description: whether expand all rows by default, works when the table has a column type="expand" or contains tree structure data

props.name: expand-row-keys
props.description: set expanded rows by this prop, prop's value is the keys of expand rows, you should set row-key before using this prop

props.name: default-sort
props.description: set the default sort column and order. property `prop` is used to set default sort column, property `order` is used to set default sort order
props.default: if `prop` is set, and `order` is not set, then `order` is default to ascending

props.name: tooltip-options
props.description: the options for the overflow tooltip, [see the following tooltip component](tooltip.html#attributes)
props.default: ^[object]`{ enterable: true, placement: 'top', showArrow: true, hideAfter: 200, popperOptions: { strategy: 'fixed' } }`

props.name: append-filter-panel-to
props.description: which element the filter panels appends to

props.name: show-summary
props.description: whether to display a summary row

props.name: sum-text
props.description: displayed text for the first column of summary row

props.name: span-method
props.description: method that returns rowspan and colspan
type: (data: { row: any, column: any, rowIndex: number, columnIndex: number }) => number[] | { rowspan: number, colspan: number }

props.name: select-on-indeterminate
props.description: controls the behavior of master checkbox in multi-select tables when only some rows are selected (but not all). If true, all rows will be selected, else deselected

props.name: load
props.description: method for loading child row data, only works when `lazy` is true
type: (row: any, treeNode: TreeNode, resolve: (data: any[]) => void) => void

props.name: tree-props
type: { hasChildren?: string, children?: string, checkStrictly?: boolean }

props.name: table-layout
props.description: sets the algorithm used to lay out table cells, rows, and columns

props.name: show-overflow-tooltip
props.description: whether to hide extra content and show them in a tooltip when hovering on the cell.It will affect all the table columns, refer to table [tooltip-options](#table-attributes)

props.name: flexible
props.description: ensure main axis minimum-size doesn't follow the content

props.name: allow-drag-last-column
props.description: whether to allow drag the last column

props.name: tooltip-formatter
type: (data: { row: any, column: any, cellValue: any }) => VNode

slots.name: append
slots.description: Contents to be inserted after the last row. You may need this slot if you want to implement infinite scroll for the table. This slot will be displayed above the summary row if there is one.

slots.name: empty
slots.description: you can customize content when data is empty.

events.name: select
events.description: triggers when user clicks the checkbox in a row

events.name: select-all
events.description: triggers when user clicks the checkbox in table header

events.name: selection-change
events.description: triggers when selection changes

events.name: cell-mouse-enter
events.description: triggers when hovering into a cell

events.name: cell-mouse-leave
events.description: triggers when hovering out of a cell

events.name: cell-click
events.description: triggers when clicking a cell

events.name: cell-dblclick
events.description: triggers when double clicking a cell

events.name: cell-contextmenu
events.description: triggers when user right clicks on a cell

events.name: row-click
events.description: triggers when clicking a row

events.name: row-contextmenu
events.description: triggers when user right clicks on a row

events.name: row-dblclick
events.description: triggers when double clicking a row

events.name: header-click
events.description: triggers when clicking a column header

events.name: header-contextmenu
events.description: triggers when user right clicks on a column header

events.name: sort-change
events.description: triggers when Table's sorting changes

events.name: filter-change
events.description: column's key. If you need to use the filter-change event, this attribute is mandatory to identify which column is being filtered

events.name: current-change
events.description: triggers when current row changes

events.name: header-dragend
events.description: triggers after changing a column's width by dragging the column header's border

events.name: expand-change
events.description: triggers when user expands or collapses a row (for expandable table, second param is expandedRows; for tree Table, second param is expanded)

events.name: scroll
events.description: Invoked after scrolled

props.name: type
props.description: type of the column. If set to `selection`, the column will display checkbox. If set to `index`, the column will display index of the row (staring from 1). If set to `expand`, the column will display expand icon

props.name: index
props.description: customize indices for each row, works on columns with `type=index`

props.name: column-key
props.description: column's key. If you need to use the filter-change event, you need this attribute to identify which column is being filtered

props.name: prop
props.description: field name. You can also use its alias: `property`

props.name: min-width
props.description: column minimum width. Columns with `width` has a fixed width, while columns with `min-width` has a width that is distributed in proportion

props.name: fixed
props.description: whether column is fixed at left / right. Will be fixed at left if `true`

props.name: render-header
props.description: render function for table header of this column

props.name: sortable
props.description: whether column can be sorted. Remote sorting can be done by setting this attribute to 'custom' and listening to the `sort-change` event of Table

props.name: sort-method
props.description: sorting method, works when `sortable` is `true`. Should return a number, just like Array.sort

props.name: sort-by
props.description: specify which property to sort by, works when `sortable` is `true` and `sort-method` is `undefined`. If set to an Array, the column will sequentially sort by the next property if the previous one is equal

props.name: sort-orders
props.description: the order of the sorting strategies used when sorting the data, works when `sortable` is `true`. Accepts an array, as the user clicks on the header, the column is sorted in order of the elements in the array

props.name: resizable
props.description: whether column width can be resized, works when `border` of `el-table` is `true`

props.name: formatter
type: (row: any, column: any, cellValue: any, index: number) => VNode

props.name: show-overflow-tooltip
props.description: whether to hide extra content and show them in a tooltip when hovering on the cell

props.name: header-align
props.description: alignment of the table header. If omitted, the value of the above `align` attribute will be applied

props.name: class-name
props.description: class name of cells in the column

props.name: label-class-name
props.description: class name of the label of this column

props.name: selectable
props.description: function that determines if a certain row can be selected, works when `type` is 'selection'

props.name: reserve-selection
props.description: whether to reserve selection after data refreshing, works when `type` is 'selection'. Note that `row-key` is required for this to work

props.name: filters
props.description: an array of data filtering options. For each element in this array, `text` and `value` are required

props.name: filter-multiple
props.description: whether data filtering supports multiple options

props.name: filter-method
props.description: data filtering method. If `filter-multiple` is on, this method will be called multiple times for each row, and a row will display if one of the calls returns `true`
type: (value: any, row: any, column: any) => void

props.name: filtered-value
props.description: filter value for selected data, might be useful when table header is rendered with `render-header`

props.name: tooltip-formatter
type: (data: { row: any, column: any, cellValue: any }) => VNode

vue-components.name: el-tabs
vue-components.description: Divide data collections which are related yet belong to different types.

props.name: name
props.description: identifier corresponding to the name of Tabs, representing the alias of the tab-pane, the default is ordinal number of the tab-pane in the sequence, e.g. the first tab-pane is '0'

events.name: tab-click
events.description: triggers when a tab is clicked

events.name: tab-change
events.description: triggers when `activeName` is changed

events.name: tab-remove
events.description: triggers when tab-remove button is clicked

events.name: tab-add
events.description: triggers when tab-add button is clicked

events.name: edit
events.description: triggers when tab-add button or tab-remove is clicked

vue-components.name: el-tag
vue-components.description: Used for marking and selection.

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when Check Tag is clicked

vue-components.name: el-text
vue-components.description: Used for text.

vue-components.name: el-time-picker
vue-components.description: Use Time Picker for time input.

props.name: model-value
props.description: binding value, if it is an array, the length should be 2

props.name: start-placeholder
props.description: placeholder for the start time in range mode

props.name: end-placeholder
props.description: placeholder for the end time in range mode

props.name: is-range
props.description: whether to pick a time range

props.name: arrow-control
props.description: whether to pick time using arrow buttons

props.name: popper-class
props.description: custom class name for TimePicker's dropdown

props.name: format
props.description: format of the displayed value in the input box

props.name: default-value
props.description: optional, default date of the calendar

props.name: value-format
props.description: optional, format of binding value. If not specified, the binding value will be a Date object

props.name: disabled-hours
props.description: To specify the array of hours that cannot be selected

props.name: disabled-minutes
props.description: To specify the array of minutes that cannot be selected
type: (hour: number, role: string, comparingDate?: Dayjs) => number[]

props.name: disabled-seconds
props.description: To specify the array of seconds that cannot be selected
type: (hour: number, minute: number, role: string, comparingDate?: Dayjs) => number[]

props.name: teleported
props.description: whether time-picker dropdown is teleported to the body

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when user confirms the value

events.name: blur
events.description: triggers when Input blurs

events.name: focus
events.description: triggers when Input focuses

events.name: clear
events.description: triggers when the clear icon is clicked in a clearable TimePicker

events.name: visible-change
events.description: triggers when the TimePicker's dropdown appears/disappears

vue-components.name: el-time-select
vue-components.description: Use Time Select for time input.

props.name: min-time
props.description: minimum time, any time before this time will be disabled

props.name: max-time
props.description: maximum time, any time after this time will be disabled

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when user confirms the value

events.name: blur
events.description: triggers when Input blurs

events.name: focus
events.description: triggers when Input focuses

events.name: clear
events.description: triggers when the clear icon is clicked in a clearable TimeSelect

vue-components.name: el-timeline
vue-components.description: Visually display timeline.

slots.name: default
slots.description: customize default content for timeline item

slots.name: dot
slots.description: customize defined node for timeline item

vue-components.name: el-tooltip
vue-components.description: Display prompt information for mouse hover.

props.name: append-to
props.description: which element the tooltip CONTENT appends to

props.name: content
props.description: display content, can be overridden by `slot#content`

props.name: raw-content
props.description: whether `content` is treated as HTML string

props.name: fallback-placements
props.description: list of possible positions for Tooltip [popper.js](https://popper.js.org/docs/v2/modifiers/flip/#fallbackplacements)

props.name: show-arrow
props.description: whether the tooltip content has an arrow

props.name: auto-close
props.description: timeout in milliseconds to hide tooltip

props.name: popper-class
props.description: custom class name for Tooltip's popper

props.name: enterable
props.description: whether the mouse can enter the tooltip

props.name: teleported
props.description: whether tooltip content is teleported, if `true` it will be teleported to where `append-to` sets

props.name: trigger
props.description: How should the tooltip be triggered (to show)

props.name: virtual-triggering
props.description: Indicates whether virtual triggering is enabled

props.name: virtual-ref
props.description: Indicates the reference element to which the tooltip is attached

props.name: trigger-keys
props.description: When you click the mouse to focus on the trigger element, you can define a set of keyboard codes to control the display of tooltip through the keyboard

props.name: persistent
props.description: when tooltip inactive and `persistent` is `false` , popconfirm will be destroyed

vue-components.name: el-tour
vue-components.description: A popup component for guiding users through a product. Use when you want to guide users through a product.

props.name: target-order
props.description: order strategy for elements in the target list. If set to `original`, the elements will keep the same order as the data source. If set to `push`, the newly added elements will be pushed to the bottom. If set to `unshift`, the newly added elements will be inserted on the top

props.name: render-content
props.description: custom render function for data items

props.name: format
props.description: texts for checking status in list header

props.name: left-default-checked
props.description: key array of initially checked data items of the left list

props.name: right-default-checked
props.description: key array of initially checked data items of the right list

slots.name: default
slots.description: Custom content for data items. The scope parameter is `{ option }`

slots.name: left-empty
slots.description: content when left panel is empty or when no data matches the filter

slots.name: right-empty
slots.description: content when right panel is empty or when no data matches the filter

events.name: change
events.description: triggers when data items change in the right list

events.name: left-check-change
events.description: triggers when end user changes the checked state of any data item in the left list

events.name: right-check-change
events.description: triggers when end user changes the checked state of any data item in the right list

props.name: cache-data
props.description: The cached data of the lazy node, the structure is the same as the data, used to get the label of the unloaded data

vue-components.name: el-<el-badge-value="beta">tree-v2-virtualized-tree</el-badge>
vue-components.description: Tree view with blazing fast scrolling performance for any amount of data

props.name: empty-text
props.description: text displayed when data is void

props.name: props
props.description: configuration options, see the following table

props.name: expand-on-click-node
props.description: whether to expand or collapse node when clicking on the node, if false, then expand or collapse node only when clicking on the arrow icon.

props.name: check-on-click-node
props.description: whether to check or uncheck node when clicking on the node, if false, the node can only be checked or unchecked by clicking on the checkbox.

props.name: default-expanded-keys
props.description: array of keys of initially expanded nodes

props.name: check-strictly
props.description: whether checked state of a node not affects its father and child nodes when `show-checkbox` is `true`

props.name: default-checked-keys
props.description: array of keys of initially checked nodes

props.name: filter-method
props.description: this function will be executed on each node when use filter method. if return `false`, tree node will be hidden.

props.name: indent
props.description: horizontal indentation of nodes in adjacent levels in pixels

slots.name: default
slots.description: Custom content for tree nodes. The scope parameter is `{ node: TreeNode, data: TreeNodeData }`

slots.name: empty
slots.description: empty you can customize content when data is empty.

events.name: node-click
events.description: triggers when a node is clicked

events.name: node-drop
events.description: triggers when drag someting and drop on a node

events.name: node-contextmenu
events.description: triggers when a node is clicked by right button

events.name: check-change
events.description: triggers when the selected state of the node changes

events.name: check
events.description: triggers after clicking the checkbox of a node

events.name: current-change
events.description: triggers when current node changes

events.name: node-expand
events.description: triggers when current node open

events.name: node-collapse
events.description: triggers when current node close

vue-components.name: el-tree
vue-components.description: Display a set of data with hierarchies.

props.name: empty-text
props.description: text displayed when data is void

props.name: node-key
props.description: unique identity key name for nodes, its value should be unique across the whole tree

props.name: props
props.description: configuration options, see the following table

props.name: render-after-expand
props.description: whether to render child nodes only after a parent node is expanded for the first time

props.name: load
props.description: method for loading subtree data, only works when `lazy` is true

props.name: default-expand-all
props.description: whether to expand all nodes by default

props.name: expand-on-click-node
props.description: whether to expand or collapse node when clicking on the node, if false, then expand or collapse node only when clicking on the arrow icon.

props.name: check-on-click-node
props.description: whether to check or uncheck node when clicking on the node, if false, the node can only be checked or unchecked by clicking on the checkbox.

props.name: auto-expand-parent
props.description: whether to expand father node when a child node is expanded

props.name: default-expanded-keys
props.description: array of keys of initially expanded nodes

props.name: check-strictly
props.description: whether checked state of a node not affects its father and child nodes when `show-checkbox` is `true`

props.name: default-checked-keys
props.description: array of keys of initially checked nodes

props.name: filter-node-method
props.description: this function will be executed on each node when use filter method. if return `false`, tree node will be hidden.

props.name: accordion
props.description: whether only one node among the same level can be expanded at one time

props.name: indent
props.description: horizontal indentation of nodes in adjacent levels in pixels

props.name: lazy
props.description: whether to lazy load leaf node, used with `load` attribute

props.name: draggable
props.description: whether enable tree nodes drag and drop

props.name: allow-drag
props.description: this function will be executed before dragging a node. If `false` is returned, the node can not be dragged

props.name: allow-drop
props.description: this function will be executed before the dragging node is dropped. If `false` is returned, the dragging node can not be dropped at the target node. `type` has three possible values: 'prev' (inserting the dragging node before the target node), 'inner' (inserting the dragging node to the target node) and 'next' (inserting the dragging node after the target node)

slots.name: default
slots.description: Custom content for tree nodes. The scope parameter is `{ node, data }`

slots.name: empty
slots.description: empty you can customize content when data is empty.

events.name: node-click
events.description: triggers when a node is clicked

events.name: node-contextmenu
events.description: triggers when a node is clicked by right button

events.name: check-change
events.description: triggers when the selected state of the node changes

events.name: check
events.description: triggers after clicking the checkbox of a node

events.name: current-change
events.description: triggers when current node changes

events.name: node-expand
events.description: triggers when current node open

events.name: node-collapse
events.description: triggers when current node close

events.name: node-drag-start
events.description: triggers when dragging starts

events.name: node-drag-enter
events.description: triggers when the dragging node enters another node

events.name: node-drag-leave
events.description: triggers when the dragging node leaves a node

events.name: node-drag-over
events.description: triggers when dragging over a node (like mouseover event)

events.name: node-drag-end
events.description: triggers when dragging ends

events.name: node-drop
events.description: triggers after the dragging node is dropped

vue-components.name: el-upload
vue-components.description: Upload files by clicking or drag-and-drop.

props.name: multiple
props.description: whether uploading multiple files is permitted.

props.name: data
props.description: additions options of request. support `Awaitable` data and `Function` since v2.3.13.

props.name: show-file-list
props.description: whether to show the uploaded file list.

props.name: drag
props.description: whether to activate drag and drop mode.

props.name: accept
props.description: accepted [file types](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#attr-accept), will not work when `thumbnail-mode === true`.

props.name: on-preview
props.description: hook function when clicking the uploaded files.

props.name: on-remove
props.description: hook function when files are removed.

props.name: on-success
type: (response: any, uploadFile: UploadFile, uploadFiles: UploadFiles) => void

props.name: on-error
props.description: hook function when some errors occurs.
type: (error: Error, uploadFile: UploadFile, uploadFiles: UploadFiles) => void

props.name: on-progress
props.description: hook function when some progress occurs.
type: (evt: UploadProgressEvent, uploadFile: UploadFile, uploadFiles: UploadFiles) => void

props.name: on-change
props.description: hook function when select file or upload file success or upload file fail.

props.name: on-exceed
props.description: hook function when limit is exceeded.

props.name: before-upload
props.description: hook function before uploading with the file to be uploaded as its parameter. If `false` is returned or a `Promise` is returned and then is rejected, uploading will be aborted.
type: (rawFile: UploadRawFile) => Awaitable<void | undefined | null | boolean | File | Blob>

props.name: before-remove
props.description: hook function before removing a file with the file and file list as its parameters. If `false` is returned or a `Promise` is returned and then is rejected, removing will be aborted.

props.name: http-request
props.description: override default xhr behavior, allowing you to implement your own upload-file's request.

vue-components.name: el-watermark
vue-components.description: Add specific text or patterns to the page.

props.name: width
props.description: The width of the watermark, the default value of `content` is its own width

props.name: height
props.description: The height of the watermark, the default value of `content` is its own height

props.name: rotate
props.description: When the watermark is drawn, the rotation Angle, unit `°`

props.name: z-index
props.description: The z-index of the appended watermark element

props.name: image
props.description: Image source, it is recommended to export 2x or 3x image, high priority

props.name: offset
props.description: The offset of the watermark from the upper left corner of the container. The default is `gap/2`

attributes.name: v-infinite-scroll
attributes.description: Load more data while reach bottom of the page

attributes.name: infinite-scroll-immediate
attributes.description: Whether to execute the loading method immediately, in case the content cannot be filled up in the initial state.

attributes.name: element-loading-text
attributes.description: loading text that displays under the spinner

attributes.name: element-loading-svg
attributes.description: icon of the custom spinner (same as element-loading-spinner)

attributes.name: element-loading-svg-view-box
attributes.description: sets the viewBox attribute for loading svg element
